<HOMOGRAPH ID="country" idm_id="000012360"><HEAD xmlns:e="urn:IDMEE"><H_S1><MAINENTRY second-colour="yes"><BASE>country</BASE><INFLX iform="plural">countries</INFLX></MAINENTRY><STARS> ★★★</STARS></H_S1><H_S2><PART-OF-SPEECH> noun</PART-OF-SPEECH><PRONS> <audio type="pronunciation" region="us" caption="British English pronunciation: country"><source type="audio/mpeg" ID="country__1"><SENSE-NUM>1</SENSE-NUM><SENSE-CONTENT><SYNTAX-CODING><SEP> [</SEP>countable<SEP>]</SEP></SYNTAX-CODING><DEFINITION resource="dict_american" query="yes"> an area of land that has its own government and official borders</DEFINITION><EXAMPLES ID="country__2"><EXAMPLE>Ministers from four Arab countries met today in Cairo.</EXAMPLE></EXAMPLES><EXAMPLES ID="country__3"><EXAMPLE>We do not have capital punishment in this country.</EXAMPLE></EXAMPLES><EXAMPLES ID="country__4"><EXAMPLE>He felt he had betrayed his country.</EXAMPLE></EXAMPLES><TXREF txtitle="General words for countries: " topic="country__1" thesaurus="american"><Ref dictionary="$dictCode" entryId="nation" bookmark="nation__1">nation</Ref>, <Ref dictionary="$dictCode" entryId="republic"
